content: in 2022 a private limited company called n appointed a notary named x to represent them mr man and mrs vrouw have decided to get a divorce by mutual consent they were married in 2006 without a prenuptial agreement and have two children together they have agreed on the division of their property including household items financial accounts and life insurance policies mr man will keep the house and take on the mortgage debt they have also agreed on joint parental authority and financial contributions for their children they have agreed on a maintenance allowance and the possibility of revising it in the future the agreement includes provisions for expenses choice of court and wage garnishment in case of nonpayment they have been informed about the maintenance claims service for collecting maintenance arrears the divorce has been finalized and recorded by the registrar the notary has confirmed the parties identities and explained their obligations they have the option to choose another notary if there are conflicting interests or unbalanced clauses the parties have accepted the terms of the agreement the cost of the legal documents is seven euros and fifty cents a draft of the legal document was sent to the parties and changes were made based on their communication the final version was read out in french and dutch languages and all parties signed it
